Sentillion Vergence Contextor Redistributable
Version 3.3 

Read Me Notes
Updated: July, 2002

This Read Me file contains Installationinformation for the Sentillion® Vergence® Contextor Redistributable.

Contents

Introduction

To Distribute the Contextor

Support

Introduction

The Contextor Redistributable is a self-extracting installer that automatically installs the Vergence Contextor.dll on the computer where it is run. It is designed to be included in the installation program of other products so that it can be launched by those products' installers and install itself without any user interaction.

The Contextor Redistributable performs several verifications before installation. If any of these verifications fails, the installation aborts. These verifications are as follows:

  • Operating System: Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT 4.0 with Service Packs 3, 4, 5, or 6; Windows 95 OSR2; or Windows 98.

  • Crypto API: crypt32.dll version 5.101.0000.0 or newer.

  • Previous versions of the Contextor must not already be installed.

  • The user installing the software must have administrator privileges (that is, the ability to create directories and the ability to create and modify registry keys).

The Contextor Redistributable is licensed by the SDK Runtime License. A copy of the license is installed with the SDK software.

Return to Contents.

To Distribute the Contextor

You, the developer using the Vergence SDK products, will create your own installation package for your customers.

Your installation package installs the Contextor by running ContextorRedist.exe from the directory where the ContextorRedist.exe resides.

The Vergence Contextor.dll is installed in the Windows system directory (typically C:\WINNT\System32 on Windows 2000).

The Vergence Contextor.dll installs without any user interaction. The installation creates a log file named SentillionSetup.log in the Windows system directory.

If any of the installation verifications fail, as described above, a dialog box displays the reason for the failure, and the installation aborts. You may want to include a statement to this effect in the Readme file for your product.

To see how this works, run ContextorRedist.exe by hand and check the contents of SentillionSetup.log to determine the results of the installation.

Return to Contents.
